meanings.definition: A line of trees or shrubs planted to provide protection from wind or to mark the boundary of an area.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted a shelterbelt of trees to shield his crops from the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The shelterbelt along the edge of the field helped reduce the impact of the wind on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The shelterbelt whispered secrets to the passing breeze, playing the role of a protective guardian.
meanings.sent4: The shelterbelt stood like a green fortress, guarding the fields against the relentless wind.
meanings.sent5: The shelterbelt swayed gracefully in the wind, a natural barrier shielding the land.

meanings.definition: To plant a shelterbelt for wind protection.
meanings.sent1: The farmers decided to shelterbelt the field to shield their crops from the harsh winds.
meanings.sent2: They shelterbelted the area to create a barrier against the strong gusts of wind.
meanings.sent3: As a fun project, they shelterbelted the backyard, pretending to be wind-blocking superheroes.
meanings.sent4: The community came together to shelterbelt the town, creating a shield against the howling wind.
meanings.sent5: To shelterbelt effectively, one must carefully choose the right trees and plant them strategically.
